workflow.name: Compare product prices on Amazon and Jumia with Decodo, OpenAI and Telegram
workflow.description:
## What Problem Does It Solve?
- We‚Äôve all been there: you want to check if a product is cheaper on Amazon or Jumia, but opening a dozen tabs is a pain.
- Building a bot to do this usually fails because big e-commerce sites love to block scrapers with CAPTCHAs.
- This workflow fixes that headache by:
  - Taking a product name from a chat message.
  - Using **Decodo** to handle the hard part‚Äîsearching Google and scraping the product pages without getting blocked.
  - Using AI to read the messy HTML and pull out just the price and product name.
  - Sending a clean "Best Price" summary back to the user instantly.

## How to Configure It
### Telegram Setup
- Create a bot with BotFather and paste your token into the Telegram node.
- Make sure your webhook is set up so the bot actually "hears" the messages.

### Decodo 
- This is the engine that makes the workflow reliable.
- You'll need to add your **Decodo API key** in the credentials.
- We used Decodo here specifically because it handles the proxies and browser fingerprinting for you‚Äîso your Amazon requests actually go through instead of failing.

### AI Setup
- Plug in your OpenAI API key (or swap the node for Claude/Gemini if you prefer).
- The system prompt is already set up to ignore ads and find the real price, but feel free to tweak the tone.

## How It Works
1. **Trigger:** You text the bot a product name (e.g., "Sony XM5").
2. **Search:** The workflow asks **Decodo** to Google that specific term on sites like Amazon.eg.
3. **Scrape:** It grabs the URLs and passes them back to Decodo to fetch the page content safely.
4. **Extract:** The AI reads through the text, finds the lowest price, and ignores the clutter.
5. **Reply:** The bot texts you back with the best deal found.

## Customization Ideas
- **Go wider:** Edit the search query to check other stores like Noon or Carrefour.
- **Track trends:** Connect a Google Sheet to log what people are searching for‚Äîgreat for market research.

If you need any help [Get In Touch](https://www.linkedin.com/in/abdallaelshikh0/)

parameters.content:
### üõçÔ∏è AI Price Monitor & Aggregator

#### How it works
This workflow takes a product name from Telegram, searches Google for purchase links (Amazon EG & Jumia), scrapes the prices, and uses AI to summarize the best deal.
1. **Trigger:** Receive product name via Telegram.
2. **Search:** Google Search finds relevant URLs.
3. **Scrape:** Parallel processing scrapes Amazon and Jumia/Other sites separately.
4. **AI Analysis:** GPT-4o extracts the product details and prices from the raw HTML.
5. **Response:** Sends a clean summary back to Telegram.

#### Setup steps
1. **Credentials:** configure your `Telegram API`, `OpenAI`, and `Decodo` credentials.
2. **Decodo:** Ensure your Decodo account allows Google Search operations.
3. **Webhook:** Verify the Telegram webhook is active.

#### Customization tips
- **Sites:** Edit the `Build Queries` node to add more stores (e.g., noon.com).
- **Filters:** Adjust the `Router` node if you want to add specific scraping logic for other domains.

## 1. Get Links & Route
Receives the user request, searches Google, and separates Amazon links from others for specialized handling.

## 2. Amazon Scraping
Specialized HTML cleaning and scoring logic optimized for Amazon product pages.

## 3. General Scraping
Generic scraping logic for Jumia and other supported e-commerce sites.

## 4. AI Extraction & Reply
Merges results and uses an AI Agent to extract structured price data and reply to the user.

options.systemMessage:
You are a product comparison extraction agent.

You will receive scraped and cleaned HTML text from multiple e-commerce pages
(Amazon, Jumia, or others), along with their URLs and relevance scores.

Your job is to:

1. Identify the SAME product across different platforms.
2. For EACH platform extract:
   - Product name (clean, human readable)
   - Price (number + currency if present)
   - Platform name (Amazon, Jumia, etc.)
   - URL
3. Compare the platforms.
4. Prepare a final user-friendly message suitable for Telegram.

STRICT RULES:
- Do NOT invent prices or product names.
- If price is missing, write "Price not found".
- If multiple prices exist on the same page, choose the most prominent product price.
- Ignore ads, bundles, delivery fees, unrelated products.
- Use ONLY the provided text.
- Be concise and clear.
- Use emojis moderately (Telegram friendly).

OUTPUT FORMAT:
Return ONLY a single formatted message string.
No JSON.
No explanations.
No markdown blocks.

user.name: Abdullah Alshiekh
user.bio:
üöÄ Automation pro building AI-powered workflows with n8n.
üíº Special focus on real use cases
üîß Love clean, flexible, and business-ready automations.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
